page.title: 02THE DAY I VISITED FORT GREY
page.content: The day I visited{Fort Grey}.As we were approaching ,it looked like a cup and saucer. It is now a Maritime Museum owned by the Ancient Monument Committee. It is not known how old it is,but it was there in 1680. You walk through a low doorway. There were 150 shipwrecks between 1734 and 1974. Downstairs there are 5 glass cases with pieces from the ships. Candlesticks,spoons,knives and a compass are from{Sprightly},which{sank in 1777.Guns, badges and knives come from the{Boreas}(1807). There are candlesticks,a teapot and a brass porthole from the{Yorouba}(1888). Outside,there is a cannon from the {Boreas}and a part of a lifeboat from the{Elwood Mead. By{Sarah Whalley
